category: Ngā Haerenga o Chocolate rāua ko Tiger

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, i tākaro a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate ki te pōro a Tiger.
sentences.english: One day, Tiger and Chocolate were playing with Tiger's ball.

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Used to refer to a specific but unspecified thing.

notes.text: i tākaro a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Particle used before a personal name.
Conjunction meaning 'and' (used to connect two names).
The name of the first person.
The name of the second person.
Particle used before a personal name.

sentences.maori: Ahakoa he rerekē ā rāua momo, he tino hoa rātou.
sentences.english: Even though they are different species, they are best friends.

notes.text: Ahakoa he rerekē ā rāua momo
notes.translation: Even though they are different species

sentences.maori: I whiua e Tiger te pōro, ā, i oma a Chocolate ki te hopu i te pōro.
sentences.english: Tiger threw the ball, and Chocolate ran to catch it.

notes.text: I whiua e Tiger te pōro

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Particle used before the subject of the verb.

notes.text: ā, i oma a Chocolate ki te hopu i te pōro
notes.translation: and Chocolate ran to catch it

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Particle used before a personal name.
Indicates the object of the action.

sentences.maori: I hoki mai a Chocolate me te pōro i roto i tōna waha, ā, i koa a Tiger.
sentences.english: Chocolate came back with the ball in his mouth, and Tiger was happy.

notes.text: I hoki mai a Chocolate me te pōro i roto i tōna waha
notes.translation: Chocolate came back with the ball in his mouth

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Particle used before a personal name.
Indicates the time of an action.
Particle used before a personal name.

sentences.maori: I tākaro rātou mō te wā roa, ā, i ngenge rātou i te mutunga.
sentences.english: They played for a long time, and they were tired in the end.

notes.text: I tākaro rātou mō te wā roa
notes.translation: They played for a long time

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

notes.text: ā, i ngenge rātou i te mutunga
notes.translation: and they were tired in the end

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

sentences.maori: I moe a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate i raro i te rākau, ā, i moemoeā rātou mō ngā tākaro āpōpō.
sentences.english: Tiger and Chocolate slept under the tree, dreaming of tomorrow's games.

notes.text: I moe a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate i raro i te rākau
notes.translation: Tiger and Chocolate slept under the tree

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.
Particle used before a personal name.
Conjunction meaning 'and' (used to connect two names).
The name of the first person.
The name of the second person.

notes.text: ā, i moemoeā rātou mō ngā tākaro āpōpō

explanations.explanation: Indicates the time of an action.

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, i tākaro a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate ki te pōro a Tiger.
sentences.english: One day, Tiger and Chocolate were playing with Tiger's ball.

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.
Conjunction meaning 'and' when joining two names.
Particle used before a personal name.

sentences.maori: I whiua e Tiger te pōro, ā, i ngaro te pōro i roto i te ngahere.
sentences.english: Tiger threw the ball, and it got lost in the forest.

notes.text: I whiua e Tiger te pōro
ā, i ngaro te pōro i roto i te ngahere
notes.translation: and it got lost in the forest

sentences.maori: I rapu a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate i te pōro mō te wā roa.
sentences.english: Tiger and Chocolate searched for the ball for a long time.

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.
Conjunction meaning 'and' when joining two names.

sentences.maori: I te mutunga, i kitea e Chocolate te pōro i raro i tētahi rākau.
sentences.english: In the end, Chocolate found the ball under a tree.

notes.text: i kitea e Chocolate te pōro

sentences.maori: I koa a Tiger, ā, i mihi ia ki a Chocolate mō tōna āwhina.
sentences.english: Tiger was happy and thanked Chocolate for his help.

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.

notes.text: ā, i mihi ia ki a Chocolate

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.

sentences.maori: I ako rātou i te hiranga o te mahi tahi me te āwhina i a rāua anō.
sentences.english: They learned the importance of working together and helping each other.

notes.text: i te hiranga o te mahi tahi
me te āwhina i a rāua anō

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.

sentences.maori: I tētahi pō, i pupuhi te hau, ā, i heke te ua kaha.
sentences.english: One night, the wind blew, and it rained heavily.

notes.text: ā, i heke te ua kaha

sentences.maori: I mataku a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate i te haruru o te whatitiri.
sentences.english: Tiger and Chocolate were scared of the thunder.

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.
Conjunction meaning 'and' when joining two names.

notes.text: i te haruru o te whatitiri

sentences.maori: I noho rātou tata ki a rāua anō ki te whakamārie i a rāua anō.
sentences.english: They stayed close to each other to comfort each other.

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.

notes.text: ki te whakamārie i a rāua anō

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.

sentences.maori: I kōrero rātou mō ngā wā pai i tākaro rātou i waho.
sentences.english: They talked about the good times they had playing outside.

sentences.maori: I te mutunga, i moe rātou i raro i te moenga, ā, i moemoeā rātou mō ngā rā pai āpōpō.
sentences.english: In the end, they slept under the bed, dreaming of better days ahead.

notes.text: i moe rātou i raro i te moenga
ā, i moemoeā rātou mō ngā rā pai āpōpō

sentences.maori: I ako rātou i te hiranga o te tautoko i a rāua anō i ngā wā uaua.
sentences.english: They learned the importance of supporting each other during tough times.

notes.text: i te hiranga o te tautoko
i a rāua anō i ngā wā uaua

explanations.explanation: Particle used before a personal name.

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, i tākaro a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate i te māra.
sentences.english: One day, Tiger and Chocolate were playing in the garden.

notes.text: I tētahi rā, i tākaro a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate i te māra.
notes.translation: One day, Tiger and Chocolate were playing in the garden.

sentences.maori: I kite rātou i tētahi manu iti kua mau ki roto i tētahi kupenga.
sentences.english: They saw a small bird trapped in a net.

notes.text: I kite rātou i tētahi manu iti kua mau ki roto i tētahi kupenga.
notes.translation: They saw a small bird trapped in a net.

sentences.maori: I whakatau rātou ki te āwhina i te manu.
sentences.english: They decided to help the bird.

notes.text: I whakatau rātou ki te āwhina i te manu.
notes.translation: They decided to help the bird.

sentences.maori: I tapahi a Chocolate i te kupenga ki ōna niho, ā, i āwhina a Tiger ki te pupuri i te kupenga.
sentences.english: Chocolate cut the net with his teeth, and Tiger helped hold the net.

notes.text: I tapahi a Chocolate i te kupenga ki ōna niho, ā, i āwhina a Tiger ki te pupuri i te kupenga.
notes.translation: Chocolate cut the net with his teeth, and Tiger helped hold the net.

sentences.maori: I te mutunga, i tukuna te manu kia rere anō.
sentences.english: In the end, they set the bird free.

notes.text: I te mutunga, i tukuna te manu kia rere anō.
notes.translation: In the end, they set the bird free.

sentences.maori: I koa rātou mō tō rātou mahi pai, ā, i ako rātou i te hiranga o te manaaki i ngā mea ora katoa.
sentences.english: They were happy with their good deed and learned the importance of caring for all living things.

notes.text: I koa rātou mō tō rātou mahi pai, ā, i ako rātou i te hiranga o te manaaki i ngā mea ora katoa.
notes.translation: They were happy with their good deed and learned the importance of caring for all living things.

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, i whakaritea e Tiger rāua ko Chocolate tētahi pikiniki.
sentences.english: One day, Tiger and Chocolate prepared a picnic.

notes.text: I tētahi rā, i whakaritea e Tiger rāua ko Chocolate tētahi pikiniki.
notes.translation: One day, Tiger and Chocolate prepared a picnic.

sentences.maori: I kawea e rātou ngā kai reka ki te papa rēhia.
sentences.english: They brought delicious food to the park.

notes.text: I kawea e rātou ngā kai reka ki te papa rēhia.
notes.translation: They brought delicious food to the park.

sentences.maori: I kite rātou i tētahi ngeru iti e noho mokemoke ana i raro i tētahi rākau.
sentences.english: They saw a small kitten sitting alone under a tree.

notes.text: I kite rātou i tētahi ngeru iti e noho mokemoke ana i raro i tētahi rākau.
notes.translation: They saw a small kitten sitting alone under a tree.

sentences.maori: I whakatau rātou ki te tono i te ngeru iti ki tō rātou pikiniki.
sentences.english: They decided to invite the kitten to their picnic.

notes.text: I whakatau rātou ki te tono i te ngeru iti ki tō rātou pikiniki.
notes.translation: They decided to invite the kitten to their picnic.

sentences.maori: I kai rātou katoa i ngā kai reka, ā, i tākaro rātou i ngā kēmu.
sentences.english: They all ate the delicious food and played games.

notes.text: I kai rātou katoa i ngā kai reka, ā, i tākaro rātou i ngā kēmu.
notes.translation: They all ate the delicious food and played games.

sentences.maori: I te mutunga, i whai hoa hou te ngeru iti, ā, i ako rātou i te hiranga o te manaaki i ngā tāngata hou.
sentences.english: In the end, the kitten made new friends, and they learned the importance of welcoming new people.

notes.text: I te mutunga, i whai hoa hou te ngeru iti, ā, i ako rātou i te hiranga o te manaaki i ngā tāngata hou.
notes.translation: In the end, the kitten made new friends, and they learned the importance of welcoming new people.

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, i kite a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate i tētahi kurī kua mau ki roto i tētahi awa.
sentences.english: One day, Tiger and Chocolate saw a dog trapped in a river.

notes.text: I tētahi rā, i kite a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate i tētahi kurī kua mau ki roto i tētahi awa.
notes.translation: One day, Tiger and Chocolate saw a dog trapped in a river.

explanations.token: i kite a Tiger rāua ko Chocolate
kua mau ki roto i tētahi awa

sentences.maori: I whakatau rātou ki te āwhina i te kurī.
sentences.english: They decided to help the dog.

notes.text: I whakatau rātou ki te āwhina i te kurī.
notes.translation: They decided to help the dog.

sentences.maori: I kaukau a Chocolate ki te awa, ā, i pupuri a Tiger i te kurī ki tōna pāwhara.
sentences.english: Chocolate swam to the river, and Tiger held the dog with his paw.

notes.text: I kaukau a Chocolate ki te awa, ā, i pupuri a Tiger i te kurī ki tōna pāwhara.
notes.translation: Chocolate swam to the river, and Tiger held the dog with his paw.

sentences.maori: I te mutunga, i whakaorangia te kurī, ā, i koa te kurī mō tō rātou āwhina.
sentences.english: In the end, they rescued the dog, and the dog was grateful for their help.

notes.text: I te mutunga, i whakaorangia te kurī, ā, i koa te kurī mō tō rātou āwhina.
notes.translation: In the end, they rescued the dog, and the dog was grateful for their help.

sentences.maori: I ako rātou i te hiranga o te āwhina i ngā tāngata katoa, ahakoa ko wai rātou.
sentences.english: They learned the importance of helping everyone, no matter who they are.

notes.text: I ako rātou i te hiranga o te āwhina i ngā tāngata katoa, ahakoa ko wai rātou.
notes.translation: They learned the importance of helping everyone, no matter who they are.

title.maori: Te Mīharo o te Rā Whānau

sentences.maori: I tētahi rā, i whakaritea e Chocolate tētahi mīharo mō te rā whānau o Tiger.
sentences.english: One day, Chocolate prepared a surprise for Tiger's birthday.

explanations.explanation: Indicates the agent performing the action.

notes.text: mō te rā whānau o Tiger

sentences.maori: I whakaritea e ia tētahi keke nui me ngā tāonga maha.
sentences.english: He prepared a big cake and many gifts.

explanations.explanation: Indicates the agent performing the action.

sentences.maori: I te taenga mai o Tiger, i mīharo ia ki te kite i te keke me ngā tāonga.
sentences.english: When Tiger arrived, he was surprised to see the cake and gifts.

notes.text: I te taenga mai o Tiger
ki te kite i te keke me ngā tāonga
notes.translation: to see the cake and gifts

sentences.maori: I kai rātou i te keke, ā, i tākaro rātou i ngā kēmu.
sentences.english: They ate the cake and played games.

sentences.maori: I te mutunga, i mihi a Tiger ki a Chocolate mō tōna manaaki.
sentences.english: In the end, Tiger thanked Chocolate for his kindness.

sentences.maori: I ako rātou i te hiranga o te manaaki i ngā hoa i ngā wā motuhake.
sentences.english: They learned the importance of caring for friends during special times.
